summary: Children exposed to lead can experience serious developmental delays. Many young children spend significant amounts of time in child care settings, including Head Start centers. We conducted a nationally-representative survey of Head Start centers. Based on that survey, we estimate that: 26% tested for lead in their drinking water; 10% of those found lead and all took action to remediate 43% had not tested 31%...
title: Child Care Facilities: Federal Agencies Need to Enhance Monitoring and Collaboration to Help Assure Drinking Water is Safe from Lead
